sourcesContent:
export const Profile = { marina_orsini_jones: { full_name: "Professor Marina Orsini-Jones", name: "Marina Orsini-Jones", image: "/img/marina_orsini_jones.jpg", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", company: "Associate Head for Global Engagement and Research Associate in the Centre forGlobal Learning / Coventry University (UK)", role: "Co-Principal Investigator and ELT Tutor", description: `Dr Marina Orsini-Jones is Professor in Education Practice and Associate Head of School (Global Engagement) in the School of Humanities and is also seconded as Research Associate to the Centre for Global Learning (GLEA) at Coventry University (UK). Marina is passionate about the internationalisation of the curriculum through Collaborative Online International Learning (COIL)/Virtual Exchange (VE) (also known as telecollaboration) and has engaged with innovation in language learning and teaching since the 1980s. She applies an action-research-informed thresholds concept pedagogy methodological approach to her work and has organised various conferences at Coventry University and workshops for other Higher Education Institutions both in the UK and overseas. She has presented at over 100 national and international conferences and is part of the editorial review boards of various journals and conferences. Marina has led numerous action research projects and teams and in 2013 she was awarded a National Teaching Fellowship from the HEA (Higher Education Academy) in the UK, in recognition of the national and international impact of her innovative work in languages and linguistics. In 2016 she obtained a Principal Fellowship, in recognition of her strategic leadership in HE. In collaboration with her colleagues in the School of Humanities and in GLEA, she set up new COIL exchanges and research collaborations with Brazil, China, France, Mexico, the Netherlands, Spain, Sri Lanka and now Vietnam with this ViVEXELT (Vietnam Virtual EXchange for English Language Teaching) project, funded by the British Council and supported by the Vietnam National Foreign Language Policy team.

Marina has published work on Virtual Exchange (VE), digital literacies, personal development planning, intercultural communicative competence and threshold concepts, often in collaboration with her students. She likes to reflect on her practice through the looking glass of her students perspectives (e.g. Towards a Role-Reversal Model of Threshold Concept Pedagogy, 2014 and Intercultural Communicative Competence for Global Citizenship, with Fiona Lee, 2018). Her most recent work (2017 to date) relates to the integration of existing FutureLearn MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses) into the English teacher education curriculum in conjunction with VE, to encourage students in English teacher education to critically review their practice and their beliefs on learning and teaching 'in' action, 'on' action and 'for' action with international communities of practice: e.g. this publication stemming from an English Language Teaching Research Award (ELTRA), funded by the British Council, available here: https://www.teachingenglish.org.uk/article/b-meltt-blending-moocs-english-language-teacher-training.

Marina is Co-Principal Investigator for ViVEXELT in collaboration with Dr Thuy Bui Thi Ngoc, Principal Investigator from Hanoi University of Science and Technology. Orcid: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5250-5682`, vn_description: `Gio s Marina Orsini-Jones l gio s chuyn ngnh v Gio dc Thc hnh - Ph Vin trng Vin Khoa hc X hi Nhn vn v ng thi cng l chuyn gia nghin cu cho Trung tm Hc tp Ton cu (GLEA) ti i hc Coventry (Vng quc Anh). Gio s Marina Orsini-Jones tp trung nghin cu qu trnh quc t ha cc chng trnh ging dy thng qua h thng Hc tp Tng tc Trc tuyn Quc t (Collaborative Online International Learning - COIL)/ Trao i o (Virtual Exchange - VE) v gio s tham gia vo tin trnh i mi trong vic hc v ging dy ngn ng t nhng nm 1980. Gio s thng xuyn trin khai nghin cu hnh ng (action research) v phng php lun s phm i vi khi nim ngng (thresholds concept) v t chc nhiu hi ngh khc nhau ti i hc Coventry v cc hi tho cho cc t chc gio dc i hc khc c Vng quc Anh v trn th gii. Gio s thuyt ging ti hn 100 hi ngh trong nc v quc t v l thnh vin ca ban bin tp ca nhiu tp ch v hi ngh. Gio s Marina Orsini-Jones qun l nhiu d n v nhm nghin cu hnh ng. Nm 2013, gio s c trao gii thng National Teaching Fellowship t Hc vin Gio dc i hc (Higher Education Academy HEA) ti Vng quc Anh ghi nhn nhng ng gp trong cng vic i mi ngn ng v ngn ng hc trong nc v quc t ca gio s. Nm 2016, gio s c trao gii thng Principal Fellowship ghi nhn nhng vai tr lnh o chin lc ca gio s i vi ngnh gio dc i hc ti Vng quc Anh. Cng tc vi cc ng nghip ca mnh ti Vin Khoa hc X hi Nhn vn v trung tm GLEA, gio s thit lp cc hp tc nghin cu v trao i COIL vi cc i tc ti Brazil, Trung Quc, Php, Mexico, H Lan, Ty Ban Nha, Sri Lanka v by gi l Vit Nam vi d n ViVEXELT do Hi ng Anh ti tr v nhm n Ngoi ng Quc gia Vit Nam h tr. Gio s Marina Orsini-Jones xut bn cc cng trnh nghin cu v nhng lnh vc nh: Trao i o, kin thc s, lp k hoch pht trin c nhn, nng lc giao tip a vn ha v cc khi nim ngng cng cc sinh vin ca mnh. Gio s lun kin nh vi cng tc chim nghim (reflection) qu trnh thc hnh ca bn thn thng qua lng knh gc nhn ca sinh vin (v d nh cng trnh Hng ti m hnh o ngc di gc nghip v s phm vi khi nim ngng vo nm 2014 v ng cng trnh nghin cu cng tc gi Fiona Lee Nng lc giao tip a vn ha tr thnh cng dn ton cu vo nm 2018). Cng trnh gn y nht ca gio s (tnh t nm 2017 cho n nay) lin quan n vic tch hp cc kha hc trc tuyn i chng m (Massive Open Online Courses MOOCs) c sn trn h thng hc trc tuyn FutureLearn vo chng trnh o to gio vin ting Anh kt hp vi VE nhm khuyn khch sinh vin Anh ng chim nghim li thc tin v quan nim ca bn thn i vi qu trnh hc tp v ging dy trong qu trnh tri nhim (reflection-in-action), v tri nghim din ra (reflection-on-action) v cho tri nghim tng lai (reflection-for-action) cng vi cc cng ng thc hnh quc t: v d: n phm nhn c gii thng English Language Teaching Research Award (ELTRA), do Hi ng Anh ti tr, c sn ti y: https://www.teachingenglish.org.uk/article/b-meltt-blending- moocs-english-language-teacher-training Gio s Marina Orsini-Jones l ng nghin cu vin chnh ca d n ViVEXELT hp tc cng Tin s Bi Th Ngc Thy Nghin cu vin chnh, Trng i hc Bch Khoa H Ni. Orcid: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5250-5682` }, thuy_thi_ngoc_bui: { full_name: "Dr Thuy Thi Ngoc Bui", name: "Thuy Thi Ngoc Bui", image: "/img/thuy_thi_ngoc_bui.jpg", company: "Deputy Head of the External Affairs Office at Hanoi University of Science and Technology (Vietnam).", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", role: "Co-Principal Investigator", description: `Dr Thuy Thi Ngoc Bui graduated from the Masters and doctoral programs in Language Policy in the U.S. under the Ford Foundation and the East-West Center scholarships. In 2015, she was awarded with the Australian Executive Fellowship to work as a visiting scholar at the University of Sydney, Australia. She has experiences working as a senior academic manager, a lecturer, and a researcher. Her research focuses on multilingualism, critical literacy, teacher agency, and the relationship between language and education policies and socio-economic equity. She has published journal articles and book chapters on these topics. Since December 2018, she has been working as a Deputy Head of the International Affairs Office at Hanoi University of Science and Technology (HUST). She has been actively working on developing partnerships between UK and Vietnam universities through the UK-VN Higher Education Partnership Network (UK-VN HEP). She also acts as a coordinator of UK-VN HEP projects on capacity building and leadership and governance.

Besides her academic positions, Thuy works as a community project manager for projects funded by the U.S and Australian embassies. Her projects focus on ELT training for teachers and enhancing academic and personal development skills and engagement for disadvantaged minority people, community leaders, and local activists.

Thuy is currently based at Hanoi University of Science and Technology where she is Deputy Head of the External Affairs Office. She is Co-Principal Investigator on ViVEXELT.`, vn_description: `Tin s Bi Th Ngc Thy tt nghip chng trnh Thc s v Tin s v Chnh sch Ngn ng ti Hoa K theo hc bng ca Qu Ford v East-West Center. Nm 2015, tin s c trao Hc bng Australian Executive Fellowship v tr thnh hc gi thnh ging ti i hc University of Sydney (c). Tin s c kinh nghim lm vic vi vai tr qun l gio dc cp cao, ging vin v nghin cu vin. Cc lnh vc nghin cu ca tin s tp trung vo ch ngha a ngn ng, ph bnh vn hc v mi quan h gia ngn ng, chnh sch gio dc v s cn bng kinh t x hi. Tin s xut bn cc bi bo trn tp ch v cc chng sch v cc ch ny. K t thng 12 nm 2018, tin s m nhim v tr Ph Trng phng Hp tc i ngoi ti Trng i hc Bch Khoa H Ni (HUST). Tin s Bi Th Ngc Thy lun tch cc lm vic trong vic pht trin quan h i tc gia cc trng i hc ti Vng quc Anh v Vit Nam thng qua h thng i tc Gio dc i hc Vit Nam Vng quc Anh (UK-VN Higher Education Partnership Network - UK-VN HEP). Tin s cng tham gia vi vai tr l iu phi vin ca cc d n HEP v nng cao nng lc, lnh o v qun tr. Ngoi ra, tin s cn tham gia qun l d n cng ng cho cc d n do i s qun Hoa K v c ti tr. Cc d n ca tin s tp trung vo o to ging dy Ting Anh cho gio vin, nng cao cc k nng hc tp v pht trin c nhn cng nh s khuyn khch dnh cho nhng i tng ngi dn tc thiu s c hon cnh kh khn, cc nh lnh o cng ng v cc nh hot ng a phng. Tin s Bi Th Ngc Thy hin ang lm vic ti Trng i hc Bch Khoa H Ni vi chc v Ph Trng phng Hp tc i ngoi. Tin s l ng nghin cu vin chnh cho d n ViVEXELT.` }, nguyen_thi_thom_thom: { name: "Nguyen Thi Thom Thom", image: "/img/nguyen_thi_thom_thom.jpg", short_description: "", company: "Lecturer / Teacher educator at Vietnam National University, Hanoi.", role: "ELT consultant and tutor", description: `Dr Nguyen Thi Thom Thom has been working as a lecturer at Faculty of English Language Teacher Education, University of Languages and International Studies Vietnam National University, Hanoi (ULIS-VNU) since 2001. She received her Masters (English Linguistics) from VNU and Doctoral degree (Education) from the University of Newcastle, Australia with the support of an Australian Awards Scholarship. Her research interests include Teacher education, Professional development and Language policy. She has presented in numerous national and international conferences as well as publishing journal articles and book chapters on these topics.

Thom is also a master trainer in a range of teacher training projects conducted by VNU, the National Foreign Languages Project Ministry of Education and Training, the British Council Vietnam and the U.S. Embassy, providing professional development programs for EFL teachers across all educational levels. Besides, she acts as an academic manager and researcher for community projects: e.g. project on Developing sustainable employability skills for ethnic minority students (09/2018 09/2019) granted by RELO and Promoting effective instructional approaches of teaching English for minority students (04/2018 04/2019) granted by U.S. Alumni. The most recent project she is involved with (2020-2022) is A Community-centered Educational Model for developing Social Resilience through play (ACES). The project is sponsored by the Global Challenges Research Fund (GCRF) and led by Coventry University (U.K.). The project aims to examine and establish an evidence-driven transformative educational model for bridging formal and informal educational contexts and spaces towards a more inclusive, safe and resilient society that empowers young people in Malaysia, Indonesia and Vietnam to flourish despite their social localities. Further information on the project is available here: https://aces.gchangers.org.

Thom is Academic consultant for this ViVEXELT (Vietnam Virtual Exchange for English Languge Teaching) project, funded by the British Council and supported by the Vietnam National Foreign Languages Project team.`, vn_description: `Tin s Nguyn Th Thm Thm cng tc ging dy ti Khoa S phm Ting Anh, Trng i hc Ngoi ng - i hc Quc gia H Ni (ULIS-VNU) t nm 2001. Tin s nhn bng Thc s (Ngn ng Anh) ti i hc Quc Gia H Ni v bng Tin s (Gio dc) ti i hc Newcastle (c) vi Hc bng Australian Awards Scholarship. Cc mi quan tm nghin cu ca tin s bao gm gio dc gio vin, pht trin ngh nghip v chnh sch ngn ng. Tin s thuyt trnh ti nhiu hi ngh quc gia v quc t cng nh xut bn cc ci nghin cu v chng sch v cc ch ny. Tin s cng l ging vin trong nhiu d n o to gio vin do i hc Quc Gia H Ni thc hin, n Ngoi ng Quc gia - B Gio dc v o to, Hi ng Anh ti Vit Nam v i s qun Hoa K, cung cp cc chng trnh nng cao chuyn mn cho gio vin Ging dy ngoi ng Ting Anh tt c cc cp hc. Bn cnh , tin s ng vai tr l nh qun l hc thut v nghin cu vin cho cc d n cng ng, v d nh D n Pht trin k nng lm vic bn vng cho sinh vin dn tc thiu s (09/2018 - 09/2019) c ti tr bi RELO v Thc y phng php ging dy ting Anh hiu qu cho hc sinh dn tc thiu s (04/2018 - 04/2019) c ti tr bi U.S. Alumni. D n gn y nht m tin s tham gia (2020-2022) l 'M hnh gio dc ly cng ng lm trung tm pht trin kh nng phc hi x hi thng qua vui chi (ACES)'. D n c ti tr bi Qu Nghin cu Thch thc Ton cu (Global Challenges Research Fund - GCRF) v do i hc Coventry (Vng quc Anh) trin khai. D n nhm mc ch kim tra v thit lp mt m hnh gio dc chuyn i da trn bng chng lm cu ni gia cc bi cnh v khng gian gio dc chnh thc v khng chnh thc hng ti mt x hi ha nhp hn, an ton v linh hot hn, trao quyn cho nhng ngi tr tui Malaysia, Indonesia v Vit Nam pht trin bt chp v tr x hi ca h. Thng tin chi tit v d n xem ti y: https://aces.gchangers.org. Tin s Nguyn Th Thm Thm l c vn hc thut cho d n ViVEXELT c ti tr bi Hi ng Anh v c h tr bi n Ngoi ng Quc gia Vit Nam.` }, zoe_gazeley_eke: { full_name: "Mrs Zoe Gazeley-Eke", name: "Zoe Gazeley-Eke", image: "/img/zoe_gazeley_eke.jpg", company: "Course Director for the BA Honours in English Language and TEFL / Coventry University (UK)", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", role: "Materials design consultant and ELT tutor", description: `Mrs Zoe Gazeley-Eke is a Lecturer in Academic English and TEFL (Teaching English as a Foreign Language) in the School of Humanities at Coventry University and is also the Course Director for the BA English Language and TEFL programme. Her main teaching is on EFL teacher training modules and materials development modules on the BA as well as on two of the schools MA courses. Zoe is also a Cambridge accredited CELTA trainer and teaches on the CELTA courses at Coventry University as well as leading on and developing modules for both UG and PG students to prepare for the Cambridge TKT (Teacher Knowledge Test).

Prior to working at Coventry University Zoe has taught various forms of English as a Foreign Language including Business English, English for Young Learners, English for Academic Purposes (EAP), and ESOL in Mexico City, Moscow, Japan, China and Saudi Arabia as well as at UK colleges and universities. Zoe continues to work on Global Engagement at Coventry Universitys partner institutions in China and Hong Kong, where she delivers EAP and English Language Testing courses in country and on-line. She is also developing COIL (Collaborative Online International Learning) projects with partners in Spain and South Africa.

Zoe is also a PhD candidate at Coventry University as part of its Staff Doctorate Programme and aligned with the research Centre for Arts, Memories and Communities (CAMC). Her thesis is investigating the development of ESAP (English for Specific Academic Purposes) pedagogy and materials for Fashion. She has presented her research at numerous national and international conferences. Zoe has also previously undertaken research on developing digital literacies, and intercultural communication and has been published in these areas. She was also the recipient of a Digital Fluency and Innovation award in the Coventry University Excellence Awards 2019 for the Augmented Reality Prison Break project which was showcased at the British Council Spark festival in Hong Kong in 2019. https://pureportal.coventry.ac.uk/en/projects/ar-prison-break.

Zoes role in this project is to facilitate and moderate the Virtual Exchange sessions and inform materials design for ViVEXELT.`, vn_description: `Thc s Zoe Gazeley-Eke l ging vin chng trnh Ting Anh hc thut v Ging dy ting Anh nh mt ngoi ng (Teaching English as a Foreign Language TEFL) ti Vin Khoa hc X hi Nhn vn ti i hc Coventry (Vng quc Anh). Thc s hin l ch nhim b mn C nhn Ngn ng Anh ng v TEFL. Cng vic ging dy chnh ca thc s l v cc chng trnh o to gio vin TEFL v pht trin ti liu trnh c nhn v cao hc. Thc s l ging vin nhn c chng ch CELTA do Cambridge cng nhn v tham gia cng tc ging dy cc kha hc CELTA ti i hc Coventry cng nh m nhim pht trin cc chng trnh hc cho sinh vin chun b cho bi thi kim tra kin thc gio vin Cambridge TKT (Teacher Knowledge Test). Trc khi lm vic ti i hc Coventry, thc s tham gia ging dy nhiu chng trnh ting Anh bao gm ting Anh thng mi, ting Anh cho thanh thiu nin, ting Anh cho mc ch hc thut (English for Academic Purposes - EAP) v ting Anh cho nhng ngi s dng ngn ng khc (English for Speakers of Other Languages -ESOL) Mexico City, Moscow, Nht Bn, Trung Quc v Rp X-t cng nh ti cc trng cao ng v i hc ti Vng quc Anh. Thc s cn m nhim cng tc v hp tc ton cu (Global Engagement) ti cc c s i tc ca i hc Coventry Trung Quc v Hng Kng, ni thc s tham gia ging dy cc kha hc EAP v Kim tra ting Anh trong nc v trc tuyn. Thc s cng ang pht trin cc d n Hc tp Tng tc Trc tuyn Quc t (Collaborative Online International Learning - COIL) vi cc i tc Ty Ban Nha v Nam Phi. Thc s Zoe Gazeley-Eke hin ang l nghin cu sinh ti trng i hc Coventry vi ti nghin cu s pht trin ca phng php s phm dnh cho Ting Anh chuyn ngnh hc thut (English for Specific Academic Purposes - ESAP) v cc ti liu v ngnh thi trang. Thc s trnh cy nghin cu ca mnh ti nhiu hi ngh quc gia v quc t. Thc s trc y cng thc hin nghin cu v vic pht trin cc ti liu s, v giao tip a vn ha v xut bn cc lnh vc nghin cu ny. Thc s cng xut sc nhn c gii thng v i mi s trong l trao gii Coventry University Excellence Awards nm 2019 cho d n Vt ngc Tng tc thc t o - Augmented Reality Prison Break c gii thiu ti l hi Spark ca Hi ng Anh Hng Kng vo nm 2019. https://pureportal.coventry.ac.uk/en/projects/ar-prison-break Vai tr ca thc s Zoe Gazeley-Eke trong d n ViVEXELT l iu phi cc phin Trao i o v cung cp thng tin v thit k ti liu cho d n.`, }, jenny_wells: { full_name: "Mrs Jenny Wells", name: "Jenny Wells", image: "img/jenny_wells.jpg", company: "Lecturer in ESP and EAP at Coventry University (UK)", role: "Research Assistant", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", description: `Mrs Jenny Wells has worked in the field of ELT since 2007 and has taught English for a range of purposes including EAP (English for Academic Purposes), ESOL (English for Speakers of Other Languages) and ESP (English for Specific Purposes, aviation English). Since 2018 she has been working as a tutor in EAP at Coventry University, a position she took up after completing her MA in English Language Teaching and Applied Linguistics (awarded with distinction), also at Coventry. Her interests include intercultural communication and the promotion of those skills with her students in the classroom.

Jenny is an Oxford University graduate and pursued a career in business, primarily in the field of logistics, before moving into teaching. She frequently draws on her business experiences to inform and enhance her teaching practice.

Jenny is the UK research assistant for ViVEXELT.`, vn_description: `Thc s Jenny Wells lm vic trong lnh vc Ging dy Ting Anh t nm 2007 v ging dy nhiu chng trnh ting Anh khc nhau bao gm ting Anh cho mc ch hc thut (English for Academic Purposes EAP), ting Anh cho ngi s dng ngn ng khc (English for Speakers of Other Languages ESOL) v ting Anh chuyn ngnh (English for Specific Purposes ESP) m c th l ting Anh cho ngnh hng khng. K t nm 2018, Thc s lm ging vin v EAP ti i hc Coventry sao khi tt nghip loi u chng trnh Thc s v Ging dy Ngn ng Anh v Ngn ng hc ng dng ti i hc Coventry. Cc lnh vc nghin cu ca thc s bao gm giao tip gia cc nn vn ha v thc y cc k nng vi hc sinh trong lp hc. Thc s Jenny Wells tt nghip i hc Oxford v theo ui s nghip kinh doanh, ch yu trong lnh vc logistics, trc khi chuyn sang lnh vc ging dy. Thc s thng xuyn rt ra nhng kinh nghim kinh doanh ca bn thn cung cp thm cc thng tin v nng cao hot ng ging dy. Thc s Jenny Wells l tr l nghin cu cho d n ViVEXELT.` }, farida_butt: { full_name: "Mrs Farida Butt", name: "Farida Butt", image: "/img/farida_butt.jpg", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", company: "ESOL (English for Speakers of Other Languages) manager at the Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre", role: "ELT consultant and expert student participant", description: `Mrs Farida Butt is an ESOL (English for Speakers of Other Languages) manager at the Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre and her role is to ensure that everyone has access to education regardless of their status or background. Faridas work at the refugee centre gives her the possibility to work with people who are seeking asylum, refugees and migrants, wanting to better their lives. She was born and bought up in Coventry and has lived in Italy for over 18 years, where she has taught English to students from ages 3 to 18: professionally in schools, organising summer clubs and after school clubs around the city in which she used to live, as well as teaching business English to business directors and their staff. Her passion is to help people around the world, who choose Coventry as their home to better their level of English in order to achieve success. Farida is currently enrolled on the English Language Teaching and Applied Linguistics Masters programme at Coventry University as a part-time student and implements TBL (Task-Based Learning) and CLT (Communicative Language Teaching) in to her everyday teaching.

Farida is a consultant and participant on ViVEXELT, in her dual role of manager at the Refugee and Migrant Centre, where she manages a team of seven English language teachers, and students on the MA in English Language Teaching and Applied Linguistics at Coventry University.`, vn_description: `C Farida Butt l ngi qun l chng trnh Ting Anh cho ngi s dng ngn ng khc (English for Speakers of Other Languages ESOL) ti Trung tm Ngi t nn v Di c Coventry v vai tr ca c l m bo rng mi ngi u c tip cn vi nn gio dc bt lun a v hoc xut thn ca mnh. Cng vic ca Farida ti trung tm t nn gip c c c hi lm vic vi nhng ngi ang xin t nn, ngi t nn v ngi di c nhng ngi mun ci thin cuc sng ca h. C sinh ra v ln ln Coventry v sng hn 18 nm, ni c dy ting Anh cho hc sinh trong nhm tui t 03 n 18 tui vi cc vai tr gio vin ph thng, iu phi vin cc cu lc b ma h v cu lc b sau gi hc xung quanh thnh ph m c tng sinh sng, cng nh dy ting Anh thng mi cho cc cn b v ngi lao ng ca cc doanh nghip. Nim am m ca c l gip mi ngi trn khp th gii, nhng ngi chn Coventry l qu hng ca h nhm nng cao trnh ting Anh t c thnh cng trong tng lai. C Farida hin ang theo hc chng trnh bn thi gian Thc s Ngn ng hc ng dng v Ging dy Ting Anh ti i hc Coventry. C hin ang p dng cc phng php ging dy ngn ng da trn nhim v (Task-based learning TBL) v phng php ging dy ngn ng giao tip (Communicative Language Teaching - CLT vo cng vic ging dy hng ngy ca mnh. Farida l chuyn vin t vn v ngi tham gia d n ViVEXELT trong vai tr qun l kp ca c ti Trung tm Ngi t nn v Di c - ni c qun l mt nhm gm by gio vin ting Anh v sinh vin ang hc chng trnh Thc s Ngn ng hc ng dng v Ging dy Ting Anh ti i hc Coventry.`, }, minh_tuan_phi: { full_name: "Mr Minh Tuan Phi", name: "Minh Tuan Phi", image: "/img/minh_tuan_phi.jpg", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", company: "English language lecturer at Thuongmai University, Hanoi (Vietnam)", role: "Consultant on e-learning, social media and translation", description: `Mr Minh Tuan Phi is an English language lecturer at Thuongmai University, Hanoi, Vietnam. During his undergraduate study at Diplomatic Academy of Vietnam, he worked as an English private tutor for IELTS candidates. In September 2013, he became an English associate lecturer in Hanoi Open University, where he worked under a module leaders supervision to give lectures on General English and Academic English. This job provided him motivation to further his study at Coventry University, where he received his Master of Arts in English Language Teaching and Applied Linguistics with Distinction in 2017. During his time at Coventry University, he gave several talks with other students regarding his learning experience and the MOOCs in the Netherlands and in the UK. His research interests include teacher education, educational technology, and autonomous learning. Returning to Vietnam, he has been involved in teaching and educational management at the same time at different academic workplaces in both public and private sectors. These positions have helped him sharpen all the essential relevant professional skills.

Tuan is a translator, mentor and consultant for the ViVEXELT project.`, vn_description: `Thc s Ph Minh Tun l ging vin Ting Anh ti trng i hc Thng Mi. Trong khong thi hc i hc ti Hc vin Ngoi giao Vit Nam, thc s tham gia cng tc ging dy ting Anh dnh cho cc th sinh IELTS ti H Ni. Vo thng 9 nm 2013, thc s bt u tham gia cng tc tr ging ting Anh ti Vin i hc M H Ni v cc chng trnh ging dy ting Anh tng qut v ting Anh hc thut. Cng vic ny gip thc s c ng lc tip tc theo hc ti i hc Coventry, ni thc s tt nghip loi u chng trnh Thc s Ngn ng hc ng dng v Ging dy Ting Anh vo nm 2017. Trong sut thi gian hc tp ti i hc Coventry, thc s c mt s cuc thuyt ging vi cc sinh vin v kinh nghim hc tp ca mnh v v chng trnh ging dy Ting Anh trc tuyn i chng m (Massive Open Online Courses MOOCs) ti cc hi ngh H Lan v Vng quc Anh. Cc lnh vc nghin cu chuyn su ca thc s bao gm o to gio vin, cng ngh trong ngnh gio dc v s t ch trong qu trnh hc tp. Tr v Vit Nam, thc s hin ang tham gia ging dy v qun l gio dc ng thi ti cc c s gio dc khc nhau c khu vc nh nc v t nhn. Nhng v tr ny gip thc s rn gia cc k nng chuyn mn lin quan n cng tc gio dc ca mnh. Thc s l dch gi, c vn v chuyn vin t vn cho d n ViVEXELT.`, }, kate_borthwick: { full_name: "Mrs Kate Borthwick", name: "Kate Borthwick", image: "/img/kate_borthwick.jpg", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", company: "Principal Enterprise Fellow in Educational Innovation, School of Modern Languages and Linguistics, University of Southampton UK and an ELT MOOC designer", role: "E-learning consultant", description: `Mrs Kate Borthwick is Principal Enterprise Fellow in Educational Innovation, School of Modern Languages and Linguistics, University of Southampton UK and an ELT MOOC (Massive Open Online Course) designer. Kate is the Lead for Digital Learning in Modern Languages and Linguistics in Humanities at the University of Southampton. She provides expert advice to colleagues in the development and creation of online educational materials/courses. Kate is also Faculty Lead for Digital Learning and responsible for leading, developing and managing Faculty open online courses. Kate has a university-wide role since 2017, as Director of the MOOC programme, within the Universitys central Digital Learning team. This role draws on her expertise in online and blended learning and in managing and leading online courses. Her role involves leading the direction and shaping of open online courses principally delivered through the FutureLearn platform.

Since 2019, Kate has had the role of Chair of the Digital Education Working Group, appointed by the Vice-President Education.

Kate has also published extensively in the field of digital innovation and open educational resources (OERs) which is the topic of the PhD she has nearly completed - and organised the prestigious international EuroCALL (European Association of Computer Assisted Language Learning) conference in August 2017 and she is a an elected executive board member of EuroCALL.

Kate is a consultant on ViVEXELT.`, vn_description: `Thc s Kate Borthwick l i din khi doanh nghip trong d n i mi Gio dc, Vin Ngn ng v Ngn ng Hin i trng i hc Southampton (Vng quc Anh) v Thc s cng l nh thit k cc chng trnh ging dy Ting Anh trc tuyn i chng m (Massive Open Online Courses MOOCs). Thc s l Trng nhm Nghin cu s v Ngn ng Hin i v Ngn ng hc ti Vin Khoa hc Nhn vn trng i hc Southampton. Thc s thng xuyn cung cp cc li khuyn chuyn mn cho cc ng nghip trong vic pht trin v to ra cc ti liu/ kha hc gio dc trc tuyn. Thc s cng ng thi l Trng khoa v Hc tp s v chu trch nhim lnh o, pht trin v qun l cc kha hc trc tuyn i chng m (MOOC) ca Khoa. i din cho trng i hc Southampton k t nm 2017, Thc s l Gim c chng trnh MOOC trong nhm trung tm Hc tp s cc trng i hc ti Vng quc Anh vi nhng ng gp chuyn mn ca Thc s trong qu trnh iu hnh v vn hnh cc kha hc trc tuyn c cung cp thng qua nn tng FutureLearn. K t nm 2019, Thc s Kate Borthwick gi vai tr Ch tch Nhm Cng tc Gio dc s. Thc s cng xut bn nhiu cng trnh nghin cu trong lnh vc i mi k thut s v ti nguyn gio dc m (Open Educational Resources - OERs). Hin thc s ang l nghin cu sinh cho cng lnh vc ny. Thc s Kate Borthwick hin cng ang lm thnh vin ban iu hnh ca Hip hi hc ngn ng bng cng c my tnh ti Chu u (European Association of Computer Assisted Language Learning _ EuroCALL) k t thng 8/2017. Thc s l chuyn vin t vn cho d n ViVEXELT.`, }, trinh_viet_dung: { full_name: 'Mr. Trinh, Viet Dung', name: `Trinh Viet Dung`, image: "/img/trinh_viet_dung.jpg", company: "Researcher and IT expert at Hanoi University of Science and Technology (Vietnam).", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", role: "ITS consultant and designer", description: `Mr. Trinh Viet Dung has 9 years experience of research at Hanoi University of Science and Technology. As project manager in HUST, he has established a broad international academic network, proposed join research projects and become founder of DYNLAB (Dynamic Innovation Laboratory) since 2017 an organisation for young entrepreneurs at HUST. Meanwhile, as a manager in manufacturing since 2010, he has significant experience in international trading and strong links to many Vietnamese and South Asian industries.

Trinh Viet Dung is the web and educational video designer for project ViVEXELT.`, vn_description: `ng Trnh Vit Dng c 9 nm kinh nghim nghin cu ti i hc Bch Khoa H Ni. L gim c d n ti HUST, ng thit lp mt mng li hc thut quc t rng ln. ng d tham gia nhiu d n nghin cu v tr thnh ngi sng lp Phng th nghim i mi (Dynamic Innovation Laboratory DYNLAB) t nm 2017 - mt t chc dnh cho cc doanh nhn tr ti HUST. ng thi, vi vai tr l mt nh qun l trong lnh vc sn xut t nm 2010, ng c nhiu kinh nghim trong giao dch quc t v c mi lin h cht ch vi nhiu ngnh cng nghip ti Vit Nam v Nam . ng Trnh Vit Dng l ngi thit k web v video gio dc cho d n ViVEXELT.`, }, nguyen_minh_hoang: { full_name: 'Mr Nguyen Minh Hoang', name: `Nguyen Minh Hoang`, image: "/img/nguyen_minh_hoang.png", company: "ITS expert and researcher at Hanoi University of Science and Technology", short_description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit", role: "Research assistant", description: `Mr. Nguyen Minh Hoang currently works at the External Affairs Office of Hanoi University of Science and Technology. With his strong background in technology, he has been actively working with different technical partner universities to establish joint projects with Hanoi University of Science and Technology. His research interests include digitalization, data management and analysis and leadership and governance in higher education. Hoang is the Vietnamese research assistant for ViVEXELT.`, vn_description: `Thc s Nguyn Minh Hong hin ang cng tc ti Phng Hp tc i ngoi Trng i hc Bch Khoa H Ni. Thc s Nguyn Minh Hong l tr l nghin cu cho d n ViVEXELT.`, }, }; export const buildQueryString = (params) => { const query = []; Object.entries(params).map((param) => { let [key, value] = param; query.push(`${key}=${encodeURIComponent(value)}`); }); return query.join("&"); };
